name: Villa del Palmar Flamingos

reviews.text: We own a timeshare here but had never stayed here. We spent a week in a 1-bedroom unit
reviews.title: Simply a great place to relax, especially with children

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the staff is fantastic. The bellboys are superb, opening our doors, giving out complementary bottled water (probably thinking we were dehydrated from a flight), and assisting with our bags.
reviews.title: Nice, but expensive and isolated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk was very good. Our room was a very close one to the front desk (first floor) but didn't have the washer and dryer (it was being repaired). With our kids, we needed this. We were moved a little later to a room also on the first floor with a W/D.
reviews.title: The Place to Really Relax and Recharge

reviews.text: Everyone was helpful in assisting us with our stay. The pool staff, the free sea lion show (in the pool), the spa, the salsa dance lessons, babysitters - all really great. One comment - babysitting was important to us. The babysitters are hotel employees working around their schedule (I believe) and we felt very comfortable with them.
reviews.title: Wonderful family vacation with children and grandchildren

reviews.text: We are not huge fans of the dinner buffet. However, we shop locally (we rent a car), ate in our room or at some local restaurants, or at the restaurant next door (pricey, but excellent food). However, the breakfast buffet is good, especially if you get a comp or 2... Also, the bar by the pool has pizzas and other more 'snacky' food that is actually pretty good.
reviews.title: Simply Amazing!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facilities are top notch and ALL the staff made sure we felt at home
reviews.title: Nice Place to spend a week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent a wonderful week at Villa del Palmar, Flamingos. They keep this property beautifully maintained both inside and out; the gardens are lush and the rooms tastefully decorated. Some of the rooms could use a little bit of an update with new couches and ottomans as the colors have faded because of the sun. There are a variety of rooms and room views, but most of them have some sort of ocean view, albeit some better than others. They have a wonderful breakfast buffet. We did not eat dinner at the resort but rather went to a small town close by called Bucerias which has a lot of wonderful restaurants and very reasonable taxi fare to get there. The pool(s) are lovely with plenty of lounge chairs as well as lounges at the beach. Good pool food and beverge service.
reviews.title: Heaven in Nuevo Vallarta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is always nice to return to a resort and see familiar faces....the bellmen, front desk check-in, waiters, maids, etc. That must mean they are happy with their jobs and the resort if happy with them in return.
reviews.title: The service is excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Did we ever feel nervous about being in Mexico? Never....
reviews.title: Beautiful and relaxing.

reviews.text: Enjoy a visit to Villa del Palmar, Flamingos!
reviews.title: Super Bell Staff

reviews.text: We have been members of the Villa Group since the 80's when there was only Villa Del Mar downtown. We have been to all of them, Puerto Vallarta Villa Del Mar, Puerto Vallarta Villa Del Palmar, Villa Del Palmar Nuevo Vallarta Flamingos, Cabo Villa Del Palmar and Cabo Villa Los Arcos. They are all great. We are working on plans to visit the new Villa resorts in Loreto and Cancun. However we just returned from Villa del Palmar Nuevo Vallarta Flamingos and as usual had a wonderful time with Kids and Grandkids. Two of our Grandaughters now 7 and 10 years old have been with us to all the Villa Group resorts mentioned above, and always ready to go again. I promised Luis, the head Bellboy, that I would write something about him, all good, of course, but realy you don't need to write anything about Luis, all you have to do is meet him and you immediatly realize how friendly and helpful he is. Over the years I've had some great conversations with him and now he trys to be the one that brings the luggage and groceries up to our room. When you see him give the Mexican handshake.
reviews.title: Villa del Palmar Flamingos, Bellboy Luis

reviews.text: This was our third visit to Villa Del Palmar Flamingos, and the best one yet. The property itself is immaculate. Service was definitely at the front of the minds of all staff. Yes...there are time share sales. Where in Mexico are there not?? They were the least pushy of any we experienced and understood "no". Antonio the bellboy was outstanding, and our waiter the entire time poolside was Alex. There were both there the entire way and made sure that every need was met. Our only complaint was folks staking out large amounts of pool chairs hours in advance then not using them all day. I guess I could have just pulled them off then sat there. Honestly if that's the worst of a vacation, I can live with it. I'd HIGHLY recommend this resort.
reviews.title: Wonderful time...top notch service!

reviews.text: The resort is spotless, extremely well-maintained, and the staff is friendly and helpful. We're members but didn't expect to get such an awesome room! We ended up in a room on the main floor of building A, directly to the left of the lobby. It is the only room on that floor, and just so happened that no one was staying above us, which felt like we had the entire building to ourselves. Upon arrival, Luis, the lead bell-boy, greeted us with a warm smile and helpful hands. Later in the week, he complemented me on my dancing skills, saying next time we'll have to dance together.
reviews.title: Personable, Helpful Staff

reviews.text: The activities staff members are sweet and intelligent, especially David, who gave me an impromptu Spanish lesson by the pool.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is gorgeous with its cascading multi-layered levels, and the hottub sits right on the beach with a stunning view of the ocean.
reviews.title: FLAMINGOS ON THE BEACH

reviews.text: A friend gave us a week of his timeshare and we traded it through Interval International for a week at the Villa del Palmar Flamingos. We chose the hotel because we wanted a beach vacation and there was not much else available for a trade. Also, it received acceptable reviews on Trip Advisor and other sites. We arrived in Puerto Vallarta on a Saturday and the airport was an absolute zoo. We quickly cleared customs and immigration (we only had carry-on luggage) and were met by a mass of screaming timeshare salesmen offering us free taxis, free fishing trips, and free lodging. We ignored them, found an ATM machine and got some pesos, and found the pedestrian bridge to the other side of the street next to the airport. At the end of the bridge was a taxi stand with taxis about half the price of those at the airport. We got to the hotel in about 20 minutes and it cost 150 pesos (a peso was worth about 9.05 cents US).
reviews.title: A very beautiful resort

reviews.text: At check in, we were told that our room would not be ready until 2:30 – about another hour. After checking our luggage with the bellman, the desk clerk told us someone would be happy to give us maps and explain the resort to us. After reading all the reports about timeshare sales at the hotel, we were skeptical but went along with the suggestion. A very nice lady spent about 20 minutes discussing restaurants and other features of the resort, gave us maps of Puerto Vallarta and Bucieras, told us about the $69 a day all-inclusive package we could buy (we passed), and told us about transportation options to various locations. Almost as an afterthought, she told us we could get discounts if we went to a timeshare presentation and gave us her name and number if we were interested. That was the only mention of timeshare sales at the hotel that week.
reviews.title: VDP Flamingos - perfect, refined

reviews.text: We had a one-bedroom unit on the ground floor on the north side of the resort. Our front door was literally 10 feet from construction of another resort but we did not hear any noise all week from the work. On the other end of the room, we walked out to a large patio with a table, several chairs and a lounger. The pool and grounds were just outside the gate from our patio. The Murphy bed in our room would not pull away from the wall so the bellman ordered a rollaway bed for us. It never came. We were told the resort was full and we could not be moved so we forced the bed away from the wall. For some strange reason, it had been screwed into the frame. That was the only flaw in our room. The place was huge, was beautifully appointed, and had every comfort we would want. The bellman said the water from the tap was purified. He was probably right because we all drank the water and never got sick. Unlike the resort’s advertisements, we did not have an ocean view from our room. However the view of the grounds and pool more than made up for this. The place was gorgeous.
reviews.title: Loved theVilla Del palmar Flamingos in Neuvo Vallarta

reviews.text: The beach at the hotel was beautiful and you could walk for miles in either direction. I usually went for a walk in the morning – north to Bucieras or south to Paradise Village – and the beach was very clean. The water was gentle enough to easily swim and there were no rocks on the bottom. However, I stepped on a stingray one day and he decided to give me a painful stab in the ankle. Hot compresses quickly calmed the pain. A staff member at the activity desk told me that stingrays are a common problem in the spring – maybe that explains why so few people were in the water. The only complaint I had about the beach is that there were only 9 small umbrellas. Lounge chairs under the shade were quickly occupied. During the week, we got to know all the vendors who frequented our beach. The timeshare salesmen from the Playa del Sol Grand next door also visited us and other guests on a regular basis but were frequently chased away by guards from our hotel. About every 20 minutes, waiters would come by to take drink or food orders. If you want to see a truly incredible beach area, take a 5-minute walk south of the hotel to the Riu Jalisco.
reviews.title: More Positive than Negative
problems in paradise
reviews.text: The pool was spectacular but, like the beach, had a shortage of umbrellas. On most days all the loungers were occupied but very few people were actually in the pool. Since our room was on the ground floor, we could easily come and go through the gate on our patio. This meant we left the sliding door to our room unlocked but we weren’t concerned - all our valuables were locked in the safe.
The bell boys seem to know all you need to know about restraunts and where to golf especially Luis. Thanks for help!
reviews.title: Family trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really LOVE Flamingos! The rooms are all elegant, the staff can't do enough when asked, the people in the area are so friendly and helpful. The conscierge are eager to please, Lucy & Esther were great, whenever we needed anything or new adventures. Edwaurdo, at the entrance, is a gem,always knowledgable and welcoming! We arrived mid-week,and our room wasn't available because the people decided to stay another week, but they scrambled to get us into a wonderful accomodation as quickly as possible (needed cleanup first). We ate leisurely while this was accomplished & were thrilled with our rooms. The place is immaculate, with a great pool area, and sandy beach with an easy 20 min. walk to Bucerias. We met a couple also from Missouri along the way going to an Artwalk there one evening (Thursdays w/open galleries,sidewalk art), & ended up eating a great dinner on the beach at their recommendation at Mezzogiorno. The owners live there & were so accomodating. We spent Sunday downtown PV(cab or bus) walking along the Malecon, family watching, performance of the Papantia Flyers (4 men suspended & circling a tall pole, with drum & flute,a religious ritual), shopping, & eating on a deck overlooking the whole scene! We can't wait to return next year!
reviews.title: Wonderful week AGAIN!

reviews.text: Our group of 4 stayed for 10 nights over Christmas 2011 in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite. The room was immaculate & absolutely amazing. The pool area is the best in the area with plenty of chairs & umbrella's with wonderful poolside food & drink service. The hottub is located right at the sand where you can overlook the surf & relax by the fireplace in the middle of the jacuzzi tub. I would say that this resort is closer to Buceria's than Nuevo Vallarta but easily accessible to both areas. I liked the two security gates that were staffed 24 hours a day. It would not be easy to get into the resort if you weren't a guest. I went to the tatawari spa for a pedicure & it was so good I went back for a facial & massage, it was a wonderful treat! Resort is medium sized and was never too crowded like some of the mega resorts, but we still had all the ammenities of a larger place. I would definitely stay here next time in the area & would recommend to even the pickiest traveler!!
reviews.title: Beautiful, friendly & safe resort near Bucerias.

reviews.text: We have stayed in this smallish, excellent resort 5 times in the past several years, most recently in early Feb 2012. The facilities are well-maintained and all levels of service are very good. It's a 5 min cab ride or 25 min walk into Bucerias which has some fine shops, a street market and many good restaurants. A 10 min cab ride takes you to the Nuevo Vallarta marina for various excursions and a 30-45 min ride takes to you PV with all that has to offer, including a growing art scene.
reviews.title: Fabulous resort - part 2

reviews.text: I spent one week at the Resort and was so impressed with everything. I indicated up front that I was not interested in the time share presentation and that wasn´t a problem. I had rented a one bedroom that was equipped with all the kitchen appliances including a dishwasher. There was even a washer and dryer in the unit. Staff were so friendly. There were lots of chairs, so you didn´t have to go out and reserve one early in the morning.
reviews.title: A great Resort that caters to your every need

reviews.text: This is my second time-share in Nuevo Vallarta. I have tried both the all inclusive meal plan and regular and loved both. The service and experience is great. Definitiely a quieter more relaxed location. Definitely recommend going if you like good service and a great time.
reviews.title: My Escape from Reality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Villa Del Palmar Flamingos in Nuevo Vallarta is a beautiful resort. Here is our experience.
reviews.title: very good, but not excellent.

reviews.text: My husband and I traveled with another couple and shared a 2 bedroom suite on the 5th floor. Our friends in the studio side of the villa did not have a good ocean view. But the pool view from both of our villas was wonderful.
reviews.title: Our worst experience in Puerto Vallarta was our visit to this hotel.

reviews.text: On our arrival we were greeted with a cold neck towel and a cold bottle of water. Nice~
reviews.title: Great Trip Love VDP Flamingos

reviews.text: After a smooth check in, we were asked by a young lady to have a seat on the couch in the beautiful lobby and she would introduce us to our "concierge". I wanted to avoid the timeshare hounds because we already own a timeshare and had traded to go to VDP ...so I asked her directly if it was a timeshare sales pitch and she told me NO.... That was not true. After we were offered a beer or maragarita,we had to sit for 1/2 hour with our delightful, smooth talking "concierge" and she gave us maps and recommendations to restaurants and excursions, ... how nice..... Then she offered us a 20% discount VIP card....... IF... we sat through their complimentary breakfast (and of course, saw their resort with a Timeshare Salesman). I had been duped... and was not happy. However, we were with friends who were opened to seeing the resort and having the breakfast, so we went.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay overall with a few minor issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our visit to the Villa del Palmar Flamingos was perfect. The pool (lagoon) was comfortably warm with different levels of depth. The resort is beautifully clean. The personnel are absolutely the best, always willing to help. The restaurants offer a wide selection of foods at all different prices, plus there is a small market where one can buy sandwiches and salads to take out. We were able to walk to the small village of Bucerias in about 20 minutes where you can feel the true flavor of Mexico.
reviews.title: Excellent facilities and beach

reviews.text: My friend and I took a week's vacation to Puerto Vallarta and stayed here. The resort is beautiful and well kept. The room was awesome, I loved the fact that it had a kitchen and washer and dryer. The staff was very friendly and made us feel very welcomed. The beach was nice, even though there was a hurricane approaching while we were there. The staff made us feel very comfortable that we would be safe and they had a hurricane plan in place.
reviews.title: Peaceful surrounding

reviews.text: There were a few events going on at the hotel, but we decided to venture out into Puerto Vallarta and explore. I highly recommend the Tequila Tour and Rhythms of the Night. I didn't like the fact that the hotel did not offer free wi-fi, but I did without. I also don't like the excessive offers for timeshares, everywhere you go in the city and beyond there are people trying to get you to partake in timeshare presentations and it got a bit frustrating after the 3rd person. However, overall the trip and resort where really nice. Oh and the pool is BEAUTIFUL one of the best and biggest I've seen.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, but limited options if you go all-inclusive

reviews.text: I travelled to this resort Jan 2012 with my husband, 5 year old daughter and a senior. The resort is located about 30 min from the airport. We booked ahead of time a private transfer service from the airport, which I highly recommend. Since we went private we were able to ask our driver to stop at a grocery store along the way to pick up some supplies (milk, juice, snacks, etc.). If you decide to purchase at the small store at the resort you will end up paying triple the cost. For those of you that are wine lovers and like having a glass in your room, you are not able to through room service. They do not inlude bottles of wine through their all-inclusive package. I purchased wine at the grocery store and saved a lot of money! Also, the all inclusive package included their room service menu which can come in handy. We used it when we wanted a snack while our daughter was napping in the afternoon and we also used it for breakfast on the day we were leaving to save on some time and finish last minute packing.
reviews.title: Beautifully cared for with great service

reviews.text: Check-in took quite a while. Not due to any line up. It was due to the extrodinary amount of paperwork that has to be filled out and then a electronic signature is set up for the all inclusive which was part of our vacation package and not something we purchased separately. If you can get it as part of your package it's highly recommended since all the food and bevarages that are available on-site are very expensive. The only negative thing I can say about their all inclusive is that you have to sign your bill every single time you order something. So if you are ordering drinks and snacks while at the pool you are not able to run a tab and have to sign the bill each and every time. Which can be annoying. I do not understand why they do it this way, especially since we all had bracelets indicating that we were all inclusive guests! And only one slightly negative comment about the all inclusive is the lack of on-site dining options. They have one buffet restaurant and one a la carte restaurant. We are used to more choices at larger resorts. With that being said, the quality of the food at both the buffet and at the a la carte was very, very good and better than most resorts we have stayed at. The menu you can order from while at the pool was amazing! We had lunch every day consisting of many various dishes to try and share.
reviews.title: Fantastic! Lodging Is a Great Value

reviews.text: I've stayed here several times and I am never disappointed. It's been several years since I was in PV, and was amazed at the new Mega grocery & Walmart on the north side of PV. My how things have grown. The resort itself is well maintained, the staff very hard working and friendly. I always feel safe and cared after. From the welcome at the door to the drinks by the pool, to the maid service, etc. it's excellent. This visit I spent much more time in Bucerias and the resort and less time in Puerto Vallarta. The room views are excellent and the landscape is wonderful. After only seeing white snow and grey skies for months, this is an amazing contrast. I would highly recommend this resort unless you want to do a lot of partying in Puerto Vallarta since it is a long cab drive away and gets expensive.
reviews.title: Such a beautiful, well kept resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outstanding property. Walk out of the room and down to the beach. What a joy to be able to sit on the beach all day.
reviews.title: Flamingos was awesome, as usual!

reviews.text: The staff was great!! Of special interest were Victor a waiter on the beach, Emma at the front desk, and two bellmen Antonio and Eduardo.
reviews.title: A great place to come back to

reviews.text: On the beach, with a huge multi-level heated pool. Rooms have complete kitchens and accessories. Good sized to large patios, with views to the pool and water. 15 minute beach walk to great (really good) local foods and shopping. Bellmen ( Antonio), all of them were very helpful. Entire staff is pleasant and helpful. Timeshare sales people are sometimes misleading (lies) and take way too long. Can be an all inclusive, but why pass up the local fare. Very relaxing overall.
reviews.title: Amazingly Terrific Holiday

reviews.text: This was our first trip to a Villa Group resort and it was absolutely terrific! We were treated like gold, with the best service and food we've had at a Resort. Our waiter on and off the beach was Crystobal...he was so friendly and so efficient...we never had to go looking for a drink, a menu or even leave the beach to eat...he made sure we were well looked after. The rooms were very clean and all rooms have a great view of the pool, beach and Bay of Banderos. Our waiter staff was terrific as well with Aldo, Imelda, Jose and Marcos serving up the best service and food we're had at a Resort, let alone All Inclusive. My hat off to the chefs! The cleaning staff and Bell Boy Luis were friendly and very helpful always. The location is great as the little "very Mexican" town of Bucerias is only a 20 minute walk along the beach. We did 4 days all inclusive at the Resort which left us 3 days to have terrific meals in a variety of restaurants right on the Beach in Bucerias. Every morning you can watch dolphins and yes, even whales, in front of the resort frolicking in the Pacific...great experience. On site the Resort offers the normal water activities and as well there is great parasailing and seadoos for rent....both were great. On site the Resort had a perfect gentleman and friend, Dario Rodregez, who represented Vallerta Adventures and would arrange anty excurision you desired. Overall, we have travelled to many resorts and I must say for relaxation, excellent service, excellent food and great people, this is the place to be!
reviews.title: Fantastic resort on the beach with excellent service, food and entertainment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at Villa group resorts for about 15 years, we have never been disappointed, we are greetd by the head bellman Eduardo witha big hug and him saying welcome home what a great way to start a vacation. The entire staff is not only very friendly,but very efficient.
reviews.title: A great resort stay

reviews.text: Let me start off by saying my husband and I currently live elsewhere in Mexico. We have been visiting the Puerto Vallarta area for the last three years during Christmas and have enjoyed our time there very much, minus the week we spent at the Villa del Palmar Flamingos in Nuevo Vallarta.
reviews.title: Expensive and Isolated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came to this hotel after already having stayed one week at their sister resort in Puerto Vallarta, also called Villa del Palmar. We bought a timeshare through the Villa del Palmar Flamingos about three years ago in December. We had never stayed at the resort we originally bought the timeshare through and thought that we would give it a try this year.
reviews.title: Birthday in Mexico

reviews.text: We went as a family unit, three adult couples and no children.
reviews.title: Great value and the resort was much nicer than we expected!

reviews.text: The check in was very easy but the front desk staff we found to be extremely rude and cold. Although we spoke to them in their native language, Spanish, we still found them to be this way.
reviews.title: A great place to relax and watch the waves.

reviews.text: You must go to the Tatewari Spa on your stay, the best massage I have ever had and the whole experience is wonderful. The food is good the atmosphere is even better. you don't have to go far because there is restaurants on the property as well as next door. This is always the vacation that all we do is RELAX! One of the best parts is there is a washer and dryer so you really don't have to pack much.
reviews.title: Love this Place!

reviews.text: The Larsen's from California
reviews.title: Another wonderful week at Villa del Palmar Flamingos, Nuevo Vallarta

reviews.text: We just came back from another trip to Villa del Palmar Flamingos. Everything was great! It is such a wonderful feeling to be greeted by the Bell Boys as soon as we step out of the taxi. It's amazing how they always give us a big welcome. They also give us suggestions about restaurants and things to do. We walked to Bucerias every morning to have breakfast. Our two favorite places are Karen's and Sweet Thing. For dinner, we went to Bucerias and we ate at Claudio's Meson Bay, El Brujo, Adauto's, and Dugarel Plays. We also went to the Fajita Republic in Nuevo Vallarta and we tried the Santa Marea Taco Bar. This year, we had six people in our group, including my three year old granddaughter, and we all had a wonderful time.
reviews.title: great times

reviews.text: went back to Villa del palmar flamingoes, my 3rd year. absolutley love it. Look forward to it evry year. It is always good to see the same staff is still there, they welcome you home and treat you like a true memeber of thier family.
reviews.title: Great week

reviews.text: Rented a 2 bedroom suite on vacationtimesharesrentals.com for less than 1/2 of what Expedia was asking. The suite was comfortable and very clean. We enjoyed the pool and activities, walks on the beach and Isi and Rosita were great with the kids. Dario booked our Dolphin swim which the whole family enjoyed. We walked to Bucerias each day for our dinners. We really enjoyed the restaurants IXTA, Karen's place and Sandrina's. Breakfast at Sweet Things was also very nice. All were definitely worth the walk or cab ride. Food at the resort was OK but a little pricey. Did not have any problem with timeshare hounding that others did. Simply said no to the presentation when we arrived. If you are interested save some money and buy resale.
reviews.title: Lovely Week by the Pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a week (July 22-29) at Flamingos. First of all....WHAT A HOTEL!!!! This place was phenomenal! The lobby was gorgeous, the service was excellent, and the pool was incredible!! It was so big with different level that left tons of space for all of the people at the resort to enjoy! It was our first anniversary and we reserved a one bedroom with a living room/kitchen with a pull out murphy bed that was so cool! Too bad we didn't have any kids to enjoy it but we thought it was great! They gave us one of the penthouse rooms on the eigth floor with the dome top and a view to just die for!! The shower and jacuzzi were great!! ;o) It was the most beautiful, cozy feeling hotel I have ever been too! Truly amazing! I must agree that the beds were hard. My husband had a hard time sleeping but I didn't think it was so bad. Everything was so great though, it didn't even matter!
reviews.title: AMAZING FIRST ANNIVERSARY!!!

reviews.text: We're early risers so it wasn't a big deal at all to find chairs at the pool although some people did. Towels are always there and you can change them as much as you'd like. We used the kayak and boogie boards that are FREE from the hotel (don't get suckered into paying to rent them next door when the resort has their own!) which my hubby LOVED! I'm a pool girl so the lounge chairs were good enough for me! Juventino, or "Tino", was so wonderful to us!! He knew us by name and everyday gave us the best service! The pina coladas and nachos are FABULOUS!! They were our favorite snacks!!
reviews.title: Beautiful place outragesly priced!!!

likes.disliked: — Outrageous prices for food, drinks, and taxi service

reviews.text: Food can be quite expensive so rent a car or take a taxi to Walmart or the Comercial Mexicana (Supermarket in the Marina) and stock up for some breakfast and lunch items. You make even want to try one of the restaurants at neighboring hotels like The Playa Del Sol Grand next door. We ordered room service so much because we loved the menu and just adored our room!
reviews.title: Most beautiful resort I've ever stayed at!

likes.liked: — The spa, the staff, and the views (every room has a pool and ocean view)!
likes.disliked: — Its remoteness, the poolchair battles, the timeshare bullying, and the out of control children.

reviews.text: We rented a car for the week (National from the airport) which was cheaper than people going back and forth in taxis. I loved the freedom of going and coming as we pleased. We were never bothered once for a time share pitch although we did see many going on at all times of the day.
reviews.title: Great Vacation!
Incredible Resort
reviews.text: Needless to say, we had an amazing time! We were so sad to leave because of all the fun we had. Honestly, all of the other hotels were not nearly as beautiful as this place. The pools were smaller and just not as nice & clean. Be on the look out for phase one of La Estancia which should be opening this winter next door. It's the same company of Villa Group that looks like it's going to be amazing! The construction may bother some but again, we are early risers so it wasn't a problem at all! Just go and enjoy paradise! Can't wait until we return!

I've been here numerous times since 2005 and have a great time every time. The facilities are wonderful, the staff helpful and the views fantastic. I do like staying in Nuevo Vallarta because I can go downtown Puerto Vallarta or go to Bucerias which I think makes it more interesting. Also, it feels safe here with the extra security checks into the resort. There is no nightlife at the resort but that keeps it safe and quiet for those nights that you want to stay in. A couple of tips - to go downtown Puerto Vallarta, take the city buses there for about $2 versus $25 or so for a cab. Of course, take a cab back though if it's late at night. Bucerias is a sleeping little town but I actually found some nightlife there this time. Shamrocks and the Drunken Duck were both a lot of fun. My only complaint is the push to get you to upgrade to the Elite card by going to a timeshare presentation. No is the answer for that one! Also, go to Mega resort by taxi to purchase food & drink and the bellman will be happy to carry up your supplies for the week. That will save you some money so you can afford some nice dinners out. Bringing the sea lion to the swimming pool during the week was very cool too. All in all, the resort staff will do everything to ensure you have a nice stay.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's been a while since our actual visit in November, 2011, and I still have mixed feelings on the rating of our experience.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We purchased our stay through Living Social and there were certainly misunderstandings between the terms of the deal and the staff at the hotel. For example, we should have received two 55-minute in-room massages per the deal...but the hotel doesn't offer that. Instead we got two 50-minute massages at very, very nice spa area, but then had to spend ten minutes getting rid of an additional "service fee" they were trying to add. We also had to go back and ask for the welcome kit / free bottle of wine / etc that were also included in the Living Social deal, but apparently unknown to the hotel staff. Finally, they were extremely adamant that we had to go on the time share presentation as part of that Living Social deal.
reviews.title: A great vacation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These things were very aggravating and certainly tainted an otherwise great stay at Palmar Flamingos. The one-bedroom suite we stayed in was fantastic. It was on the top floor, with awesome views of the pool, the fabulous sunsets and Banderas Bay. The pool is great (though you need to grab pool-side chairs early in the morning to get a decent spot) and with the pricey all-inclusive meal plan add on (fortunately included with the Living Social deal), the service was almost too good! SInce pool-side waiters know everything's included, they are very quick to provide service / re-fills etc. More than once, a new drink was brought without my even asking.
reviews.title: The good, the bad, and the ugly....

reviews.text: The two main restaurants that are part of the all-inclusive plan are hit or miss on the food quality (and in my opinion, certainly over-priced if we were paying). The breakfast buffet was very good, with a huge assortment of options. The dinner options at both restaurants varied greatly in quality. Hint...make sure you have bug spray before eating dinner outside at either restaurant. While you may not see whatever it is biting you....by the end of dinner, you'll find yourself with many, suddenly very itchy, bites.
reviews.title: Nice, but didn’t quite meet my expectations

reviews.text: This resort is just stunning! From the huge lobby area to the amazing beach, everything about it is a feast for the eyes! Over Christmas the place was just beautifully decked out with flowers and trees, a nativity scene etc. So nice because the weather didn't feel like winter! The staff is friendly and very helpful, trying to fulfill every request. Every guest seemed to have a smile on their face! I highly recommend it to everyone - young and old alike!
reviews.title: a beautiful resort!

reviews.text: Just returned home from this trip and it's hard to believe anyone could write a negative word about this resort. I cannot comment on the timeshare presentation because I told them right away after check in that I wasn't interested, and I was never bothered about it again.
reviews.title: My only complaint is that it just wasn't long enough!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband, two of my children (ages 12 and 7), and I stayed in a one bedroom suite all inclusive on the third floor (room 1303a) from Jan 31 to Feb 5, 2012. We had a wonderful experience. The hotel itself is beautiful. From the lobby, to the restaurants, to the pool and grounds it was all beautiful, extremely clean, and modern. The attention to detail was amazing. The employees genuinely seem happy and truely try their best to please the guest.
reviews.title: Great resort, frustrating management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our hotel room was huge. It had a kitchen with everything you would need if you did not stay all inclusive. A full-size fridge, dishwasher, stove, oven, microwave, and all dishes and utensils. Also had a bar to sit at to eat as well as a table and chairs. The living room had a couch and chair with a TV, and a murphy bed (which the kids slept on all week). There was also a bathroom with shower, and a washer and dryer (free to use) in the main living space. The bedroom had a king-sized bed with very soft comfortable bedding. I slept better than I ever have before in Mexico. Also in our bedroom we had a jacuzzi tub double vanities and sinks, and our own shower. The closet was huge with tons of space for clothes, and there was a safe in the closet that worked well. There were slippers and robes in the closet for us to use which was great. Our balcony was HUGE and so nice. There was a table and chairs on it as well as two lounge chairs.
reviews.title: Expensive and Isolated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With all inclusive stays, 24 hour room service is included as is turn down service. Every night they came in and pulled the murphy bed down, getting it ready for use. In the morning when they cleaned the room, they put it back up. It really was a great way for the four of us to stay as a family, giving my husband and me some privacy as well.
reviews.title: Best Relaxing Resort in Vallarta
Hotel great--avoid timeshare presentation
reviews.text: We just got back from a 6 day stay at the Villa Del Palmar Flamingos (June 26-July 2). This hotel is immaculate. The staff does a wonderful job of cleaning the rooms, sidewalks, pool, even the bulkheads. You would be hard pressed to find one piece of litter, anywhere. The Staff was very friendly, and very helpful/ We ate many meals at the poolside restaurant, and beside the pool. The Mahi Mahi was delicious. Better than anything we had in Hawaii, and we were right on the beach. They have live music to add to your enjoyment, and we liked them so much, we bought their CD. We ate a morning buffet in the enclosed restaurant, and it was great. We had the lobster on our last night at the restaurant, and it was good, though not as good as the price would indicate.

The Poolside Activity people are really great about getting everyone involved. We loved the volleyball games in the pool, and the water balloon fights, also in the pool. They conduct Bingo games, and give Spanish lessons, too. The waiters were very good at remembering what we ordered, and were always very attentive. The pool has two levels, and was one of the warmest pools I have ever swam in. The hot tub was great, also, but not as warm as you would expect.
reviews.title: Excellent place, nice location
Romantic Getaway!
reviews.text: We even took in the massage. Very relaxing, and we needed it after sleeping on the mattresses. Kind of pricey, but we had coupons and discounts, and after all, we were on vacation. I could really get use to that kind of treatment..

We did think that the mattresses were too firm. and we had problems with the air conditioning in our room during the first two days. Seems there is a little bolt on the sliding door that needs to depress a button on the door frame to activate the air conditioning--if they are not lined up exactly, you can not get the air conditioning to turn on.
reviews.title: Beautiful time share/resort in great location!

reviews.text: We did the timeshare presentation, as we were promised that it was very low pressure. Some friends of ours just purchased a timehare at a different hotel down the beach, so we thought, why not? You get a free buffet breakfast with the timeshare person, $50 dollars (US), a bottle of champagne or tequilla, and a Gold Card, that allows you to get a discount at the deli (excellent sandwiches), and the two restaurants and Spa. The villa is so nice, it should sell itself, and it would, if the timeshare presentation was not so high pressure. We were told it was only a 90 minute presentation, but for us, we waisted 3 hours. "You would buy into this, if you loved your wife." "Think of your children, and their children (my son is only 14)' "If you do not take this deal, then obviously, you do not like good vacations". "I can't guarantee the price, if you walk out that door. Price is only good now, won't be available later today." I would recommend that they avoid these types of presentation strategies. The program is good, but with that type of presentation, and the fact that we had three other people try to close the deal after our guide left us, was not very pleasant. I would avoid the sales pitch, unless you are ready to write the check right away. We had to get assistance from the hotel concierge to get the tequilla and coupons after we decided not to do the timeshare. Not ready to spend over $50,000 on an impulse.
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful facility!!

reviews.text: We just returned to our nightmare in paradise at the Villa Del Palmar Flamingos in Nuevo Vallarta. Where to begin? The only good I have to say is that the hotel is clean and the staff, although challenged in the English language are friendly, that is until you decide you do not want to buy a timeshare. We did the 1 1/2 hour tour ( actually took 3 1/2 hours). Very pushy. We actually had a problem with the closer they sent us to, told the manager about it, but he seemed uninterested.
reviews.title: Trouble in Paradise
Under Construction! Time Share Trap!
reviews.text: If you are not an owner or prospective owner you are treated terribly.

reviews.title: Avoid the timeshare pitch, and you'll be fine
reviews.text: We checked in and the lamp and fan were broken in the bedroom, yes they did fix it two days later. We lost electricity for five hours one day, and cable tv for two days, and believe me, there is nothing to do there at night but watch tv. There are only two restaurants in the hotel, both have terrible food, the only thing we found edible was the thin crust pizza. You can always attend one of the shows they have there for entertainment and food, but the entertainment was second rate and the food, well lets just say that after attending the Spanish show we were ill for three days. We went into town by bus the first time, but it was crowded and no air conditioning. It takes two buses to get to downtown. The next time we took a cab, that cost 40.00 round trip.

reviews.title: Don't touch the in-room phones!
reviews.text: You are constantly approached by jewelry vendors on the beach.

reviews.title: thanks jimmy munoz
reviews.text: I would NEVER return there again. Total waste of money!!!!!

aka: Villa Del Palmar Flamingos Hotel Nuevo Vallarta
